intro: Jumellea subcordata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved jumellea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub with smooth, greyish bark and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow and are arranged in clusters. Jumellea subcordata is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to dry, coastal environments.
